description: Uniquification of sequence A025058 (numbers of form i*j + j*k + k*i, where 1 <= i < j < k).
comments: Non-Idoneal Numbers. [_Artur Jasinski_, Oct 27 2008]Conjecture: If i, j and k are allowed to be negative, but not zero, and are still distinct, then the sequence is all the integers. - _Jon Perry_, Apr 21 2013
links: Bo Gyu Jeong, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2000
mathematica: aa = {}; Do[Do[Do[k = a b + b c + c a; AppendTo[aa, a b + b c + c a], {a, 1, b - 1}], {b, 2, c - 1}], {c, 3, 10}]; Union[aa] (* _Artur Jasinski_, Oct 27 2008 *)
author: _Clark Kimberling_
